"**If This World Were Mine** " is a 1967 song by [soul music](/wiki/Soul_music
"Soul music") duo [Marvin Gaye](/wiki/Marvin_Gaye "Marvin Gaye") and [Tammi
Terrell](/wiki/Tammi_Terrell "Tammi Terrell") from their album
_[United](/wiki/United_\(Marvin_Gaye_and_Tammi_Terrell_album\) "United
\(Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell album\)")_. Written solely by Gaye, it was one
of the few songs they recorded without [Ashford &
Simpson](/wiki/Ashford_%26_Simpson "Ashford & Simpson") writing or producing.
When it was released as a [single](/wiki/Single_\(music\) "Single \(music\)")
in November 1967 as the B-side to the duo's "[If I Could Build My Whole World
Around You](/wiki/If_I_Could_Build_My_Whole_World_Around_You "If I Could Build
My Whole World Around You")", it hit the _Billboard_ [pop singles
chart](/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100 "Billboard Hot 100"), peaking at number sixty-
eight, and peaked at number twenty-seven on the _Billboard_ [R&B singles
chart](/wiki/Hot_R%26B/Hip-Hop_Songs "Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs"). Gaye would
later put the song into his [set list](/wiki/Set_list "Set list") during his
last tours in the early-1980s as he performed a medley of his hits with
Terrell. The song was covered a year later by Joe Bataan on the 1968 Fania
Allstars LP _Live at the Red Garter, Vol. 2_ , and in 1969 by Ambrose Slade
(pre-[Slade](/wiki/Slade "Slade")) on their album
_[Beginnings](/wiki/Beginnings_\(Ambrose_Slade_album\) "Beginnings \(Ambrose
Slade album\)")_.

Fifteen years after the original recording, [Luther
Vandross](/wiki/Luther_Vandross "Luther Vandross") and [Cheryl
Lynn](/wiki/Cheryl_Lynn "Cheryl Lynn") re-recorded it for her album _[Instant
Love](/wiki/Instant_Love "Instant Love")_ and made the song a
[R&B](/wiki/Rhythm_and_blues "Rhythm and blues") top five smash peaking at
number four in 1982 on the _Billboard_ [Hot R&B Singles](/wiki/Hot_R%26B/Hip-
Hop_Songs "Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs") chart.

### Other
versions[[edit](/w/index.php?title=If_This_World_Were_Mine&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Other versions")]

A decade later, [Coko](/wiki/Coko "Coko") of [SWV](/wiki/SWV "SWV") and rising
R&B singer and [Tyrese](/wiki/Tyrese_Gibson "Tyrese Gibson") recorded it for
her 1999 solo album _Hot Coko_. The song is featured on [John
Legend](/wiki/John_Legend "John Legend")'s 2004 live album _[Solo Sessions
Vol. 1: Live at the Knitting
Factory](/wiki/Solo_Sessions_Vol._1:_Live_at_the_Knitting_Factory "Solo
Sessions Vol. 1: Live at the Knitting Factory")_ , with [Imani
Uzuri](/wiki/Imani_Uzuri "Imani Uzuri") singing the female lead.

In 2005, [Alicia Keys](/wiki/Alicia_Keys "Alicia Keys") and [Jermaine
Paul](/wiki/Jermaine_Paul "Jermaine Paul") recorded it for the Luther Vandross
tribute album _[So Amazing: An All-Star Tribute to Luther
Vandross](/wiki/So_Amazing:_An_All-Star_Tribute_to_Luther_Vandross "So
Amazing: An All-Star Tribute to Luther Vandross")_. The song was nominated
[Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with
Vocals](/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Best_R%26B_Performance_by_a_Duo_or_Group_with_Vocals
"Grammy Award for Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals") at the
[Grammy Awards](/wiki/Grammy_Awards "Grammy Awards"). [2] They did not win;
instead, the Grammy was awarded to [Beyoncé
Knowles](/wiki/Beyonc%C3%A9_Knowles "Beyoncé Knowles") and [Stevie
Wonder](/wiki/Stevie_Wonder "Stevie Wonder") for their cover "So Amazing,"
which appeared on the same Vandross tribute album.

##
Sampling[[edit](/w/index.php?title=If_This_World_Were_Mine&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Sampling")]

R&B singer [Tweet](/wiki/Tweet_\(singer\) "Tweet \(singer\)")
[sampled](/wiki/Sampling_\(music\) "Sampling \(music\)") the Gaye/Terrell
original for the intro of her 2005 single "[Turn Da Lights
Off](/wiki/Turn_Da_Lights_Off "Turn Da Lights Off")", featuring [Missy
Elliott](/wiki/Missy_Elliott "Missy Elliott"). In 2013 American [house
music](/wiki/House_music "House music") producer [Chris
Malinchak](/wiki/Chris_Malinchak "Chris Malinchak") sampled the song on "[So
Good to Me](/wiki/So_Good_to_Me "So Good to Me")".
